column4: <robyromania> hi, can you recommend me the best video player/codec in ubuntu to play HD content? <--- maybe mplayer can partially handle BD but i don`t recall having read about BD protection being cracked
<robyromania> <Fate_Testarossa> what do you mean my BD? <--- didn`t you ask about blu-ray?
!stab abhijit
what, no stabbing service?
why are you !tab`ing others?
what if want to copy the line i`m responding to?
you don`t expect me to retype it, do you?
so what's the best codec for decoding mkv in mplayer? i have a 3 ghz pentium 4
mkv is a container
codecs are different thing
but i reckon you`ve got AVC (also called H.264 among other names) there
which means you want ffh264 (FFmpeg H.264 implementation)
if it`s available, mplayer will use it
btw, it`s compiled in mplayer
at least usually
no idea about precompiled mplayer builds in ubuntu as i build it myself
oh
right
you could try vlc for starters

ok, thanks. i'm not really a starter, there's just a lot of codecs and it takes me too much time to test them all, with all the options. i thought, maybe i find someone experienced in HD vide decoding
oh you meant that by hd
:D
vlc is pretty bad
yeah, i meant high definiton. like 720p and 1080p
